newsitem.title: SPAIN: MOTOR RACING-ALESI QUICKEST BUT JORDANS IMPRESS.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-ALESI QUICKEST BUT JORDANS IMPRESS.

text.p: Frenchman Jean Alesi, much maligned in recent weeks after a poor start to the season, bounced back by clocking the fastest time in Friday's opening free practice for Sunday's Spanish Grand Prix.
Alesi, in his Renault-powered Benetton, clocked a best time of one minute 19.566 seconds on the Circuit de Catalunya to raise hopes of his first podium finish of the year.
He was two-tenths of a second quicker than his nearest rival Jacques Villeneuve of Canada in a Williams.
But both men were almost outshone for effort and enthusiasm by the youth of the Jordan Peugeot team as German Ralf Schumacher, 21, and Italian Giancarlo Fisichella, 24, were third and fourth fastest.
